comment.author: 43372015@N02
comment._content: Great image it captures the moment well.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/43372015@N02] They look so young and carefree, well except for the guy on the right - looks very watchful, but it seems more as if he's wary of cheating than of any danger...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 81769042@N00
comment._content: Taken on one of the ships going to Cork or Kerry ?

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/81769042@N00] Could well be, which'd make this very late July/early August 1922...

comment.author: 81769042@N00
comment._content: Well.... we know that WD Hogan accompanied the troops to Passage West...

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/81769042@N00] We do indeed - thanks to vintary and all of the rest of you who helped with this one...

comment.author: 91549360@N03
comment._content: This photograph was more than likely taken on board the commandeered London and North Western Railway Co's TSS Arvonia ( ex Cambria) while on its way to Passage West early August 1922.[http://www.flickr.com/photos/91549360@N03/9257271429/]. See also Secret Destination.
